data.message: FB how come you are stealing numbers out of my phone to recommend friends. people check your people who know you. they just sent me a friend request of a guy in my phone from 5 years ago that i never met.. offing furniture repair guy that is only known to me through my cell phone. Check your stuff peeps. FB is getting very ummm questionable

replies.message: Hi Bonnie. To stop syncing your phone contacts, please visit your Settings within the Messenger app. Learn more at: http://bit.ly/2dsaPa6. -Jessica
So are you saying unless we know this you invade us? Not a very nice feature. I should feel safe with you! You are taking liberties with me! Not kool fb

Peeps beware fb is in your cell phone. I have never said yes to their asking to confirm my cell phone number. But fb took it upon themselves to sneak into an in confirmed phone number and stock me. You are over the line now fb
huh remember that user agreement that u agreed to, yeah thats part of it so dont complain about it

fb ...Please help me.. Do not ignore me. can see I send the message for you? 
https://youtu.be/3aAYUWBwsuE

They also access your photos w/o you doing it. That's what slideshows are, you take a bunch of photos and Facebook compiles a "slide show that only you can see" unless you allow it to post. However, it should be noted that someone sees it because any nudity (or just unpleasant buttocks photos that I took myself) means no slideshow is "generated". Someone has access to your photos on your phone at all times lol
